intro: Meriania selvaflorensis, commonly known as the Selva Florensis Mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforests. Its foliage consists of large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
